New Records: Quinton de Kock hit the highest score of the tournament so far with 174 runs.
Quinton de Kock's 174 is the ninth-biggest total in men's World Cup history.
Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock scored 174 runs off 140 balls.
Bangladesh was bowled out for 233 in 46.4 overs.
Mahmudullah scored a run-a-ball 111 for Bangladesh.
David Miller made 34 not out off 15 balls.
Marco Jansen removed Tanzid Hasan and Najmul Hossain Shanto with successive deliveries.
Pre-Game Insights: Aiden Markram led the side in the absence of the unwell Temba Bavuma.
Quinton de Kock had announced he would quit one-day internationals after the World Cup in India.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa have now won four of their five pool-stage games and sit second in the table.
Bangladesh moved off the foot of the table on net run rate, with England dropping back down to last place.
